adaptivetooltips.title: Adaptive Tooltips
adaptivetooltips.group.content_manipulat: This group of options modifies the content of the tooltip.
adaptivetooltips.opt.text_wrapping.title: Text Wrapping
adaptivetooltips.opt.text_wrapping.desc: How Adaptive Tooltips wraps tooltip text.
adaptivetooltips.opt.overwrite_vanilla_w: Stop vanilla from applying its own text wrapping to tooltips in the GUI and use AdaptiveTooltip's instead.
adaptivetooltips.group.positioning.title: Positioning
adaptivetooltips.group.positioning.desc: This group of options determines where the tooltip will appear on the screen.
adaptivetooltips.opt.prioritize_tooltip_: When the tooltip height is larger than the screen height, by default, minecraft prioritizes fitting the bottom on the screen, cutting off the top. This option changes that priority to the top, cutting off the bottom.
Prevents vertical check for %s because tooltip never goes above screen.
adaptivetooltips.opt.bedrock_centering.d: When the tooltip is too long to be rendered on the screen, the tooltip is positioned in the center of the mouse, instead of the left or the right.
adaptivetooltips.opt.align_to_corner.des: When all else fails (including bedrock centering) Adaptive Tooltips determines the least obstructive corner to align the tooltip too. Best to be used with screen width text wrapping.
adaptivetooltips.opt.always_align_corner: Always align to corners, even when it is not needed.
adaptivetooltips.opt.prevent_vanilla_cla: As of 1.19.3, Minecraft prevents tooltips from going off the left side of the screen by setting a minimum position of 0. This can make tooltips overlap the hovered element and interfere with AdaptiveTooltips' tweaks.
adaptivetooltips.opt.only_reposition_hov: As of 1.19.3, Minecraft added two types of tooltip positioning: Hover & Focused. 'Hover' is the old method, 'Focused' places tooltips above or below a button widget. Disabling this setting allows AdaptiveTooltips to reposition all types of positioners, including focused and any other modded ones.
adaptivetooltips.opt.use_yacl_tooltip_po: Use the positioning of YetAnotherConfigLib for all GUI button widgets. (The same position as the tooltip you are reading this in)
adaptivetooltips.group.scrolling.title: Scrolling
adaptivetooltips.group.scrolling.desc: Controls behavior of the scrolling feature in AdaptiveTooltips.
adaptivetooltips.label.scrolling_instruc: Hold %s and scroll while a tooltip is displaying to scroll up and down on it, scroll left and right to move it horizontally. Alternatively, hold %s at the same time to scroll horizontally instead.
adaptivetooltips.opt.smooth_scrolling.de: Tooltip scrolling appears smooth, instead of instant.
adaptivetooltips.opt.scroll_direction.de: Which direction tooltip scrolling goes in.
adaptivetooltips.opt.vertical_scroll_sen: Amount of pixels to move the tooltip vertically per scroll step.
adaptivetooltips.opt.horizontal_scroll_s: Amount of pixels to move the tooltip horizontal per scroll step.
adaptivetooltips.group.style.title: Style
adaptivetooltips.group.style.desc: Options that modify how tooltips look.
adaptivetooltips.opt.tooltip_transparenc: Modifies the transparency of tooltips by a percentage.
adaptivetooltips.opt.remove_first_line_p: Removes the extra 2 pixels of line padding from the first line of the tooltip.
adaptivetooltips.wrap_text_behaviour.scr: Wraps tooltips based on how wide the screen is. Designed to be paired with 'Bedrock Centering' option.
adaptivetooltips.wrap_text_behaviour.rem: Wraps tooltips based on amount of space left until the edge of the screen.
Only works with hover tooltip positioners! For more details see description of 'Only Reposition Hover Tooltips'.
adaptivetooltips.wrap_text_behaviour.hal: Wraps tooltips with the max width of half of the screen width, so tooltips can at most, only fill half of your screen horizontally.
adaptivetooltips.wrap_text_behaviour.sma: Wraps lines that are considerably longer than the others, with a hard limit of 3/4 of the screen width.
